stimulusHtml: Governments most directly dealt with the type of concerns expressed by Vleminckx in the report by doing which of the following?

features.html:
“[Working in the coal mines] women’s nature becomes impregnated with a coarseness altogether too masculine. [She acquires] the most detestable education, the grossest language, the basest manners. Woman goes there to cast off the principal qualities that distinguish her sex; there she contracts men’s habits, the allures of independence and liberty which later become the cause of disputes, of quarrels, and even of acts of violence. Earning a rather high wage, she becomes extravagant, and no longer knows the value of money. Habituated to going out every day, her house’s interior becomes a burden.”

Dr. Jean-François Vleminckx, report to the Belgian Royal Academy of Medicine, 1870

choicesHtml: Extending the right to vote to the working class and to women
Passing laws restricting the labor of women and children in mines and factories
